intro: Fimbristylis strigosa, commonly known as the hairy threadgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually green or brown, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Fimbristylis strigosa plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems.
